security: Redaction of Social Security numbers due to privacy concerns: "The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy..."
summary: This document includes the Assassination Records Review Board's final determination to postpone the release of Social Security numbers within HSCA staff payroll records and related correspondence regarding Robert P. Buras, Jr.'s employment and salary with the Select Committee on Assassinations.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection of documents pertains to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records and includes the Assassination Records Review Board's decision to postpone the release of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. It also contains correspondence, including letters and payroll authorization forms, detailing the employment and salary of Robert P. Buras, Jr., with the HSCA, his previous employment with the New Orleans Police Department, and discrepancies in his payments.
title: HSCA Staff Payroll Records: Final Determination and Correspondence Regarding Robert P. Buras, Jr.
sender: Thomas Howarth, Budget Officer of the Select Committee on Assassinations (House of Representatives)., Cliff Fenton, Professor G. Robert Blakey
